ds

Class ApiCommunication

  • java.lang.Object
    • ds.ApiCommunication

  • @Path(value="")
public class ApiCommunication
extends java.lang.Object
    ApiCommunication class is responsible for responding to HTTP requests. It also translates Routes between JSON and Java objects which are later processed by DbCommunication.

      Constructors

      ApiCommunication()

      java.lang.String receiveRoute(javax.json.JsonObject data)
      Receveives Route and using jsonToJavaObj(javax.json.JsonObject) and DbCommunication.addRouteToDb(ds.route.Route) adds it to DataBase.

      • getDocumentation

        @GET
 @Produces(value="text/html")
public java.lang.String getDocumentation()

      • receiveRoute

        @Path(value="/send_route")
 @POST
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
 @Consumes(value="application/json")
public java.lang.String receiveRoute(javax.json.JsonObject data)
        Receveives Route and using jsonToJavaObj(javax.json.JsonObject) and DbCommunication.addRouteToDb(ds.route.Route) adds it to DataBase.
        Parameters:
        data -
        Returns:
        {String} operationStatus

      • SearchRouteById

        @Path(value="search_route_by_id/{routeId}")
 @GET
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
public java.lang.String SearchRouteById(@PathParam(value="routeId")
                                                                                                                            java.lang.String routeId)
        Returns route in JSON format with requested ID from data base using DbCommunication.getRouteFromDb(java.lang.String) To convert Java obj to JSON uses javaObjToJson(ds.route.Route) This method can be accesed by making a HTTP request in an ULR: .../api/search_route_by_id/{Place.place_name}
        Parameters:
        routeId -
        Returns:
        {JSON String} requestedRoute

      • SearchRouteByCityName

        @Path(value="search_route_by_city/{cityName}")
 @GET
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
public java.lang.String SearchRouteByCityName(@PathParam(value="cityName")
                                                                                                                                     java.lang.String cityName)
        Returns JSON array of Routes in requested City. Uses DbCommunication.getRouteFromDbByCityName(java.lang.String) and routesArrayToJsonArray(ds.route.Route[]) This method can be accesed by making a HTTP request in an ULR: .../api/search_route_by_city/{Route.city_name}
        Parameters:
        cityName -
        Returns:
        {JSON Array String} routesArray
